info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 6:43AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL SHELBY, NORTHERN DARKE, WESTERN AUGLAIZE AND MERCER COUNTIES THROUGH 715 AM EST... At 643 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located near Fort Recovery, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Celina, St. Marys, Coldwater, New Bremen, Minster, St. Henry, Fort Loramie, Fort Recovery, Wabash, Mendon, Osgood, Chickasaw, Burkettsville, North Star, Montezuma, New Weston, Yorkshire, Tama, Egypt and Maria Stein. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
